snippet: Personalized disease forecasts and therapies are not the wave of the future, research on twins suggests.
abstract: Study by Johns Hopkins researchers in journal Science Translational Medicine finds that genetic sequencing is unlikely to provide a reliable method by which to predict an individual's health and medical future.
lead_paragraph: Personalized disease forecasts and therapies are not the wave of the future, research on twins suggests.

headline.main: Study Says DNA’s Power to Predict Illness Is Limited
headline.print_headline: Capacity Of Genome To Predict Is Limited
